intro: Sessea hypotephrodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sesseae, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
